name: Caesar Smash Burger

ingredients.name: 2% plain Greek yogurt and light mayonnaise

preparation: In a large fry pan, heat oil over medium-high heat.
Meanwhile, in a bowl, combine ground beef and 2 tbsp dressing mix. Form into four pucks (do not form patties).

Add pucks to pan, leaving enough room to smash them down. Work in batches, if necessary. Using a spatula, press down on each puck until they’re smashed and thinned out. Cook 3–4 min per side, or until the edges start to brown.
To make sauce, combine yogurt, mayonnaise, and remaining 1⁄2 tbsp dressing mix. Finely chop garlic clove and whisk in, if using. Set aside.
Cut tomato into thick slices; slice onion into rings.
Spread sauce on top and bottom buns. Place patty on bottom bun; top with tomato, onion, and lettuce. Cover.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup sliced veggies, your choice.

products.name: Caesar Dressing Mix
summary: This dressing is a little bit of magic: It’s rich, creamy, full of flavor, and it has zero sodium! Take it far beyond Caesar salad and use it as a sauce for pizza, a dip for veggies, chicken fingers, and zucchini fries, or mix it in your white pasta sauce. Simply mix the blend with mayo or Greek yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, and milk, and it’s ready for anything!
